body:
Attempting to compile the following in a declaration file crashes in 0.29.16. 
```cython
ctypedef void (broken*)(object)
```
Output of compilation is
 ```
(base) PS C:\Users\Mitchell\PHYS280\Final Project> cython -3 test.pxd >test                                             
Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
ctypedef void (broken*)(object)              ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pxd:1:15: 'broken' is not a type identifier

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
ctypedef void (broken*)(object)             ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pxd:1:14: Function cannot return a function

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
ctypedef void (broken*)(object)^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pxd:1:0: Compiler crash in AnalyseDeclarationsTransform

File 'ModuleNode.py', line 124, in analyse_declarations: ModuleNode(test.pxd:1:0,
    full_module_name = 'test',
    is_pxd = True)
File 'Nodes.py', line 431, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(test.pxd:1:0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 1618, in analyse_declarations: CTypeDefNode(test.pxd:1:0,
    in_pxd = True,
    visibility = 'private')

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "C:\Users\Mitchell\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\Nodes.py", line 1618, in analyse_declarations
    cname=cname, visibility=self.visibility, api=self.api)
  File "C:\Users\Mitchell\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\Symtab.py", line 537, in declare_typedef
    cname = self.mangle(Naming.type_prefix, name)
  File "C:\Users\Mitchell\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\Symtab.py", line 395, in mangle
    return self.parent_scope.mangle(prefix, self.name)
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'mangle'

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
ctypedef void (broken*)(object)              ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pxd:1:15: 'broken' is not a type identifier

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
ctypedef void (broken*)(object)             ^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pxd:1:14: Function cannot return a function

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
ctypedef void (broken*)(object)^
------------------------------------------------------------

test.pxd:1:0: Compiler crash in AnalyseDeclarationsTransform

File 'ModuleNode.py', line 124, in analyse_declarations: ModuleNode(test.pxd:1:0,
    full_module_name = 'test')
File 'Nodes.py', line 431, in analyse_declarations: StatListNode(test.pxd:1:0)
File 'Nodes.py', line 1618, in analyse_declarations: CTypeDefNode(test.pxd:1:0,
    visibility = 'private')

Compiler crash traceback from this point on:
  File "C:\Users\Mitchell\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\Nodes.py", line 1618, in analyse_declarations
    cname=cname, visibility=self.visibility, api=self.api)
  File "C:\Users\Mitchell\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\Symtab.py", line 537, in declare_typedef
    cname = self.mangle(Naming.type_prefix, name)
  File "C:\Users\Mitchell\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\Cython\Compiler\Symtab.py", line 395, in mangle
    return self.parent_scope.mangle(prefix, self.name)
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'mangle'
```
This is **not** a blocking issue. Splitting the typedef as 
```cython
ctypedef void _broken(object)
ctypedef _broken* broken
```
works.

The relevant portion of the  C-header that led to this is 
```c
struct state;
typedef void (bound_conditions*)(state*,double,void*);
```

comment_data.body:
Agreed that there shouldn't be a crash, so this is a bug.
But didn't you mean `typedef void (*bound_conditions)(state*,double,void*);` instead ?
Yes, I copied that after working around the problem and put the star in the wrong place.

title: Starred function pointers crash compiler
